info.title: KeyVaultClient
info.description: The key vault client performs cryptographic key operations and vault operations against the Key Vault service.

parameters.name: vaultBaseUrl
parameters.description: The vault name, for example https://myvault.vault.azure.net.

post.description: Creates a new key, stores it, then returns key parameters and attributes to the client. The create key operation can be used to create any key type in Azure Key Vault. If the named key already exists, Azure Key Vault creates a new version of the key. Authorization: Requires the keys/create permission.

parameters.name: key-name
parameters.description: The name for the new key. The system will generate the version name for the new key.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: The parameters to create a key.

200.description: A key bundle containing the result of the create key request.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

put.description: Imports an externally created key, stores it, and returns key parameters and attributes to the client. The import key operation may be used to import any key type into an Azure Key Vault. If the named key already exists, Azure Key Vault creates a new version of the key. Authorization: requires the keys/import permission.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: The parameters to import a key.

200.description: Imported key bundle to the vault.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

delete.description: Deletes a key of any type from storage in Azure Key Vault. The delete key operation cannot be used to remove individual versions of a key. This operation removes the cryptographic material associated with the key, which means the key is not usable for Sign/Verify, Wrap/Unwrap or Encrypt/Decrypt operations. Authorization: Requires the keys/delete permission.

parameters.name: key-name
parameters.description: The name of the key to delete.

200.description: The public part of the deleted key and deletion information on when the key will be purged.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

patch.description: The update key operation changes specified attributes of a stored key and can be applied to any key type and key version stored in Azure Key Vault. The cryptographic material of a key itself cannot be changed. In order to perform this operation, the key must already exist in the Key Vault. Authorization: requires the keys/update permission.

parameters.name: key-name
parameters.description: The name of key to update.

parameters.name: key-version
parameters.description: The version of the key to update.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: The parameters for the key to update.

200.description: The updated key.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Gets the public part of a stored key. The get key operation is applicable to all key types. If the requested key is symmetric, then no key material is released in the response. Authorization: Requires the keys/get permission.

parameters.name: key-name
parameters.description: The name of the key to get.

parameters.name: key-version
parameters.description: Adding the version parameter retrieves a specific version of a key.

200.description: A key bundle containing the key and its attributes.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Retrieves a list of individual key versions with the same key name. The full key identifier, attributes, and tags are provided in the response. Authorization: Requires the keys/list permission.

parameters.name: maxresults
parameters.description: Maximum number of results to return in a page. If not specified the service will return up to 25 results.

200.description: A response message containing a list of keys along with a link to the next page of keys.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: List keys in the specified vault.

parameters.name: maxresults
parameters.description: Maximum number of results to return in a page. If not specified the service will return up to 25 results.

200.description: A response message containing a list of keys in the vault along with a link to the next page of keys.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description: Requests that a backup of the specified key be downloaded to the client.

200.description: The backup blob containing the backed up key.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description: Restores a backed up key to a vault.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: The parameters to restore the key.

200.description: Restored key bundle in the vault.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description: Encrypts an arbitrary sequence of bytes using an encryption key that is stored in a key vault.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: The parameters for the encryption operation.

200.description: The encryption result.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description: Decrypts a single block of encrypted data.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: The parameters for the decryption operation.

200.description: The decryption result.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description: Creates a signature from a digest using the specified key.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: The parameters for the signing operation.

200.description: The signature value.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description: Verifies a signature using a specified key.

200.description: The verification result.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description: Wraps a symmetric key using a specified key.

200.description: The wrapped symmetric key.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description: Unwraps a symmetric key using the specified key that was initially used for wrapping that key.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: The parameters for the key operation.

200.description: The unwrapped symmetric key.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: List deleted keys in the specified vault

parameters.name: maxresults
parameters.description: Maximum number of results to return in a page. If not specified the service will return up to 25 results.

200.description: A response message containing a list of deleted keys in the vault along with a link to the next page of deleted keys

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Retrieves the deleted key information plus its attributes

200.description: A DeletedKeyBundle consisting of a WebKey plus its Attributes and deletion info

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

delete.description: Deletes the specified key forever. aka purges the key.

204.description: No content signaling that the key was purged forever.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description: Recovers the deleted key back to its current version under /keys

parameters.name: key-name
parameters.description: The name of the deleted key

200.description: A Key bundle of the original key and its attributes

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

put.description: Sets a secret in a specified key vault.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: The parameters for setting the secret.

200.description: A secret bundle containing the result of the set secret request.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

delete.description: Deletes a secret from a specified key vault.

200.description: The deleted secret and information on when the secret will be deleted, and how to recover the deleted secret.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

patch.description: Updates the attributes associated with a specified secret in a given key vault.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: The parameters for update secret operation.

200.description: The updated secret.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Get a specified secret from a given key vault.

200.description: The retrieved secret.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: List secrets in a specified key vault

parameters.name: maxresults
parameters.description: Maximum number of results to return in a page. If not specified the service will return up to 25 results.

200.description: A response message containing a list of secrets in the vault along with a link to the next page of secrets.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: List the versions of the specified secret.

parameters.name: maxresults
parameters.description: Maximum number of results to return in a page. If not specified the service will return up to 25 results.

200.description: A response message containing a list of secrets along with a link to the next page of secrets

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: List deleted secrets in the specified vault

parameters.name: maxresults
parameters.description: Maximum number of results to return in a page. If not specified the service will return up to 25 results.

200.description: A response message containing a list of deleted secrets in the vault along with a link to the next page of deleted secrets

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Retrieves the deleted secret information plus its attributes

200.description: A Secret bundle of the secret and its attributes

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

delete.description: Deletes the specified secret forever. aka purges the secret.

204.description: No content signaling that the secret was purged forever.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description: Recovers the deleted secret back to its current version under /secrets

parameters.name: secret-name
parameters.description: The name of the deleted secret

200.description: A Secret bundle of the original secret and its attributes

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: List certificates in a specified key vault

parameters.name: maxresults
parameters.description: Maximum number of results to return in a page. If not specified the service will return up to 25 results.

200.description: A response message containing a list of certificates along with a link to the next page of certificates.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

delete.description: Deletes a certificate from a specified key vault.

200.description: The deleted certificate.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

put.description: Sets the certificate contacts for the specified key vault.

parameters.name: contacts
parameters.description: The contacts for the key vault certificate.

200.description: The contacts for the key vault certificate.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Lists the certificate contacts for a specified key vault.

200.description: The contacts for the key vault certificate.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

delete.description: Deletes the certificate contacts for a specified key vault.

200.description: The contacts for the key vault certificate.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: List certificate issuers for a specified key vault.

parameters.name: maxresults
parameters.description: Maximum number of results to return in a page. If not specified the service will return up to 25 results.

200.description: A response message containing a list of certificate issuers in a key vault along with a link to the next page of certificate issuers.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

200.description: The issuer for the key vault certificate.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

200.description: The issuer for the key vault certificate.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

200.description: The issuer for the key vault certificate.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

200.description: The issuer for the key vault certificate.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description: Creates a new certificate. If this is the first version, the certificate resource is created.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: The parameters to create a certificate.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description: Imports a certificate into a specified key vault.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: The parameters to import the certificate.

200.description: Imported certificate bundle to the vault.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: List the versions of a certificate.

parameters.name: maxresults
parameters.description: Maximum number of results to return in a page. If not specified the service will return up to 25 results.

200.description: A response message containing a list of certificates in the key vault along with a link to the next page of keys.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Lists the policy for a certificate.

parameters.name: certificate-name
parameters.description: The name of the certificate in a given key vault.

200.description: The certificate policy.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

patch.description: Updates the policy for a certificate. Set specified members in the certificate policy. Leave others as null.

parameters.name: certificate-name
parameters.description: The name of the certificate in the given vault.

200.description: The certificate policy

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

patch.description: Updates the specified attributes associated with the given certificate.

parameters.name: certificate-name
parameters.description: The name of the certificate in the given key vault.

200.description: The updated certificate.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Gets information about a specified certificate.

parameters.name: certificate-name
parameters.description: The name of the certificate in the given vault.

200.description: The retrieved certificate.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

200.description: A message containing the certificate operation response.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Gets the operation associated with a specified certificate.

200.description: The certificate operation response.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

delete.description: Deletes the operation for a specified certificate.

200.description: A message containing the certificate operation response.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description: Merges a certificate or a certificate chain with a key pair existing on the server.

201.description: Merged certificate bundle to the vault.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

enabled.description: Determines whether the object is enabled.

Attributes.description: The object attributes managed by the KeyVault service.

kty.description: Supported JsonWebKey key types (kty) for Elliptic Curve, RSA, HSM, Octet. Kty is usually set to RSA

q.description: RSA secret prime, with p < q.

key_hsm.description: HSM Token, used with 'Bring Your Own Key'.

KeyAttributes.description: The attributes of a key managed by the key vault service.

tags.description: Application specific metadata in the form of key-value pairs.

managed.description: True if the key's lifetime is managed by key vault. If this is a key backing a certificate, then managed will be true.

KeyBundle.description: A KeyBundle consisting of a WebKey plus its attributes.

tags.description: Application specific metadata in the form of key-value pairs.

managed.description: True if the key's lifetime is managed by key vault. If this is a key backing a certificate, then managed will be true.

KeyItem.description: The key item containing key metadata.

recoveryId.description: The url of the recovery object, used to identify and recover the deleted key.

scheduledPurgeDate.description: The time when the key is scheduled to be purged, in UTC

deletedDate.description: The time when the key was deleted, in UTC

DeletedKeyBundle.description: A DeletedKeyBundle consisting of a WebKey plus its Attributes and deletion info

recoveryId.description: The url of the recovery object, used to identify and recover the deleted key.

scheduledPurgeDate.description: The time when the key is scheduled to be purged, in UTC

deletedDate.description: The time when the key was deleted, in UTC

DeletedKeyItem.description: The deleted key item containing the deleted key metadata and information about deletion.

contentType.description: The content type of the secret.

tags.description: Application specific metadata in the form of key-value pairs.

kid.description: If this is a secret backing a KV certificate, then this field specifies the corresponding key backing the KV certificate.

managed.description: True if the secret's lifetime is managed by key vault. If this is a secret backing a certificate, then managed will be true.

SecretBundle.description: A secret consisting of a value, id and its attributes.

tags.description: Application specific metadata in the form of key-value pairs.

contentType.description: Type of the secret value such as a password.

managed.description: True if the secret's lifetime is managed by key vault. If this is a key backing a certificate, then managed will be true.

SecretItem.description: The secret item containing secret metadata.

recoveryId.description: The url of the recovery object, used to identify and recover the deleted secret.

scheduledPurgeDate.description: The time when the secret is scheduled to be purged, in UTC

deletedDate.description: The time when the secret was deleted, in UTC

DeletedSecretBundle.description: A Deleted Secret consisting of its previous id, attributes and its tags, as well as information on when it will be purged.

recoveryId.description: The url of the recovery object, used to identify and recover the deleted secret.

scheduledPurgeDate.description: The time when the secret is scheduled to be purged, in UTC

deletedDate.description: The time when the secret was deleted, in UTC

DeletedSecretItem.description: The deleted secret item containing metadata about the deleted secret.

tags.description: Application specific metadata in the form of key-value pairs.

CertificateItem.description: The certificate item containing certificate metadata.

CertificateIssuerItem.description: The certificate issuer item containing certificate issuer metadata.

contentType.description: The content type of the secret.

tags.description: Application specific metadata in the form of key-value pairs

CertificateBundle.description: A certificate bundle consists of a certificate (X509) plus its attributes.

issuer.description: Parameters for the issuer of the X509 component of a certificate.

csr.description: The certificate signing request (CSR) that is being used in the certificate operation.

cancellation_requested.description: Indicates if cancellation was requested on the certificate operation.

status_details.description: The status details of the certificate operation.

error.description: Error encountered, if any, during the certificate operation.

target.description: Location which contains the result of the certificate operation.

CertificateOperation.description: A certificate operation is returned in case of asynchronous requests.

key_props.description: Properties of the key backing a certificate.

secret_props.description: Properties of the secret backing a certificate.

x509_props.description: Properties of the X509 component of a certificate.

lifetime_actions.description: Actions that will be performed by Key Vault over the lifetime of a certificate.

issuer.description: Parameters for the issuer of the X509 component of a certificate.

exportable.description: Indicates if the private key can be exported.

key_size.description: The key size in bytes. For example;  1024 or 2048.

reuse_key.description: Indicates if the same key pair will be used on certificate renewal.

KeyProperties.description: Properties of the key pair backing a certificate.

SecretProperties.description: Properties of the key backing a certificate.

subject.description: The subject name. Should be a valid X509 distinguished Name.

validity_months.description: The duration that the ceritifcate is valid in months.

X509CertificateProperties.description: Properties of the X509 component of a certificate.

name.description: Name of the referenced issuer object or reserved names; for example, 'Self' or 'Unknown'.

cty.description: Type of certificate to be requested from the issuer provider.

IssuerParameters.description: Parameters for the issuer of the X509 component of a certificate.

trigger.description: The condition that will execute the action.

action.description: The action that will be executed.

LifetimeAction.description: Action and its trigger that will be performed by Key Vault over the lifetime of a certificate.

Action.description: The action that will be executed.

lifetime_percentage.description: Percentage of lifetime at which to trigger. Value should be between 1 and 99.

Trigger.description: A condition to be satisfied for an action to be executed.

SubjectAlternativeNames.description: The subject alternate names of a X509 object.

credentials.description: The credentials to be used for the issuer.

org_details.description: Details of the organization as provided to the issuer.

IssuerBundle.description: The issuer for Key Vault certificate.

enabled.description: Determines whether the issuer is enabled.

IssuerAttributes.description: The attributes of an issuer managed by the Key Vault service.

IssuerCredentials.description: The credentials to be used for the certificate issuer.

OrganizationDetails.description: Details of the organization of the certificate issuer.

AdministratorDetails.description: Details of the organization administrator of the certificate issuer.

contacts.description: The contact list for the vault certificates.

Contacts.description: The contacts for the vault certificates.

Contact.description: The contact information for the vault certificates.

kty.description: The type of key to create. For valid key types, see JsonWebKeyType. Supported JsonWebKey key types (kty) for Elliptic Curve, RSA, HSM, Octet

key_size.description: The key size in bytes. For example, 1024 or 2048.

items.description: JSON web key operations. For more information, see JsonWebKeyOperation.

tags.description: Application specific metadata in the form of key-value pairs.

Hsm.description: Whether to import as a hardware key (HSM) or software key.

tags.description: Application specific metadata in the form of key-value pairs.

alg.description: The signing/verification algorithm identifier. For more information on possible algorithm types, see JsonWebKeySignatureAlgorithm.
The signing/verification algorithm. For more information on possible algorithm types, see JsonWebKeySignatureAlgorithm.

key_ops.description: Json web key operations. For more information on possible key operations, see JsonWebKeyOperation.

tags.description: Application specific metadata in the form of key-value pairs.

value.description: The backup blob associated with a key bundle.

tags.description: Application specific metadata in the form of key-value pairs.

contentType.description: Type of the secret value such as a password.
Type of the secret value such as a password.

policy.description: The management policy for the certificate.

pwd.description: If the private key in base64EncodedCertificate is encrypted, the password used for encryption.

policy.description: The management policy for the certificate.

policy.description: The management policy for the certificate.

x5c.description: The certificate or the certificate chain to merge.

tags.description: Application specific metadata in the form of key-value pairs.

credentials.description: The credentials to be used for the issuer.

org_details.description: Details of the organization as provided to the issuer.

cancellation_requested.description: Indicates if cancellation was requested on the certificate operation.

value.description: True if the signature is verified, otherwise false.
A response message containing a list of keys in the key vault along with a link to the next page of keys.

nextLink.description: The URL to get the next set of keys.

value.description: A response message containing a list of deleted keys in the vault along with a link to the next page of deleted keys

nextLink.description: The URL to get the next set of deleted keys.

DeletedKeyListResult.description: A list of keys that have been deleted in this vault.

value.description: A response message containing a list of secrets in the key vault along with a link to the next page of secrets.

nextLink.description: The URL to get the next set of secrets.

value.description: A response message containing a list of the deleted secrets in the vault along with a link to the next page of deleted secrets

nextLink.description: The URL to get the next set of deleted secrets.

value.description: A response message containing a list of certificates in the key vault along with a link to the next page of certificates.

nextLink.description: The URL to get the next set of certificates.

value.description: A response message containing a list of certificate issuers in the key vault along with a link to the next page of certificate issuers.

nextLink.description: The URL to get the next set of certificate issuers.

value.description: The backup blob containing the backed up key.

BackupKeyResult.description: The backup key result, containing the backup blob.

value.description: The pending certificate signing request as Base64 encoded string.

PendingCertificateSigningRequestResult.description: The pending certificate signing request result.
